title: Arpeggio: 11th in C# (Shape: G)
content:
# Arpeggio: 11th in C# (Shape: G)

An arpeggio is the playing of the notes of a chord in a broken sequence rather than all at once. The 11th arpeggio played in the key of C# with the shape of G involves the notes G#, C#, E#, B, F#, and G# in a broken sequence.

## Notes and Intervals
- G# is the root note
- C# is the major third from G#
- E# is the perfect fifth from G#
- B is the major 9th from G#
- F# is the major 13th from G#
- G# is the root note an octave higher

## Musical Flavor and Genre
This arpeggio has a bright and uplifting sound due to the major chord tones involved. It can add a sense of tension and resolution in a musical piece. Arpeggios are commonly used in various music genres such as classical, jazz, rock, and pop music to create melodic interest and highlight harmonic progressions.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the 11th arpeggio in C# with the shape of G:
1. "Cliffs of Dover" by Eric Johnson - This instrumental rock song showcases intricate arpeggios and melodic lines.
2. "Rhapsody in Blue" by George Gershwin - This classical piece features arpeggios played on the piano in a jazzy style.
3. "Sweet Child o' Mine" by Guns N' Roses - The intro riff of this rock classic includes arpeggios, adding a melodic flair to the song.
